Quasimorph is a turn-based rogue-like game.

Health Points
Health is a key indicator of the character's condition. When health drops to zero, the character dies. Health can be restored by using autodocs, medkits, treating wounds with high-quality fixing materials, or maintaining a good diet.

Movement
Depending on the chosen type of movement, the player has a different number of actions per turn. Sneaky movement is slow and grants only one action point per turn but provides bonuses to stealth and allows interaction with doors, objects, and inventory without spending action points. Normal movement grants two action points per turn without any penalties or bonuses. Sprinting is the fastest. It grants three action points per turn, but the player cannot interact with doors, objects, or inventory. Each movement type consumes a different amount of calories per action, which is a key parameter for your character. A high-calorie reserve activates natural regeneration (+1 HP per turn), while a low reserve leads to atrophy (-1 HP per turn). Activating character’s perks also consumes calories. Don't be surprised that the satiety level drops so quickly. The heroes you control are clones with their metabolism turned up to maximum.

Perks
Active perks are triggered automatically when certain activation conditions are met. Each perk has its own trigger. After activating a perk, the character receives temporary bonuses and gradually improves the perk through gained experience. Passive perks constantly affect the player, and just like active perks, their level rises up when the character performs the specified actions, such as shooting a specific weapon or moving while overloaded, and so on.

Quasimorphosis
Quasimorphosis level increases due to the influence of subtle things residing in the bramfaturas of the Solar System's planets. These things are called quasimorphs. At low quasimorphosis levels, enemies behave passively, but as it increases, they become more aggressive. At higher levels a breakthrough may occur between the subtle and physical realms, granting demons the ability to manifest. Manifested demons always spend their first turn phasing, during which they exist between two realities and are invulnerable to weapons, but they also cannot attack the player’s character.

Wounds
Successful attacks on the character can not only reduce health but also cause wounds. To heal wounds it is necessary to use items with wound-fixing properties. The effectiveness of such fixation depends on the wound and the type of item used. However, even a fixed wound has a chance of infection, so it is useful to apply antibiotics or sorbents. A fixed wound may be healed over time or reopened. In the latter case, the fixation procedure needs to be repeated. Morphine and First-Aid Kits allow the fixation of all current wounds and can be used from fast slots even while sprinting. An autodoc heals all wounds with a single charge excluding amputations. Particularly strong substances such as morphine, alcohol, cigarettes, and gavvakh can cause addiction. Each type of addiction has its own penalties. Repeated use of the substance will reverse the progression of the addiction, but will not cure it. Having a sharp melee weapon in the inventory allows for the amputation procedure. Be careful! Amputating some body parts is fatal.

Weapons and Armor
In the areas where your PMC operates, there is always an abundance of weapons. Each type of ranged weapon has its own type of ammunition and different rates of fire. Acquaint yourself with not only the characteristics of the weapons but also the ammunition, many of them have special effects. In addition to the usual damage types, there are also composite types: explosive (blunt and piercing) and plasma (cutting and fire). The appropriate lowest value of two armor attributes protects against it. Over time weapons may break. You can always disassemble weapons you don’t use into spare parts. You can repair the weapons you use with these parts. Same goes for armor. Cloth can be disassembled into rags. Fabric is necessary for wound fixation (see above) as well as for repairing other cloth and backpacks. Broken weapons cannot be used and broken armor does not provide damage resistance. Your items will spill out every turn if the backpack or the vest holding them are broken. Accuracy, dodge, and armor damage reduction have upper caps and bonuses for exceeding them. If the accuracy becomes more than 95%, then every 10% above increases the chance of a critical hit by 1%, after which the accuracy decreases to 95%. If the dodge becomes more than 95%, then every 10% above will reduce the chance of getting a wound by 1%, after which the dodge is reduced to 95%. Armor cannot reduce incoming damage by more than 95% of its value.

Interactive Objects
The elevator is a key object on each floor of the station. It transports the player to the next floor. Useful items can be found in closets, drawers, and shelves. Medical cases and weapon crates contain corresponding items. Autodocs allow for healing and treating wounds. To use them, one charge is required, and you can replenish the charge by spending a certain number of energy batteries. The level scanner provides more information about the current level on the mini-map. It also uses energy batteries to gather new data. Doors can not only be opened but also closed or locked. Interaction options with the door are available by right-clicking, as well as information about enemies.

Factions and missions
The strength of a faction is determined by two parameters: Power and Technology. Power affects the number of enemies and the loot on a mission. Technology determines the equipment available to factions, which they can use or sell. These parameters grow over time depending on the stations in the faction's possession, but they are also affected by completed missions. Sabotage reduces the station owner's Power and Technology. Espionage reduces the station owner's Technology. Elimination reduces the victim's Power, but if the target was a scientist then Technology. Capture will change the owner of the station, and Defense, on the contrary, will prevent this change. If a faction has not fully paid out the reward for a mission it will accumulate a debt that can be used in the next barter. Factions and their characteristics can be viewed in the first tab of the Stock Exchange.

Barter and market
Since PMCs are illegal organizations they are not connected to the system-wide trading network and are not included in the economy based on reputation. However, corporations agree to exchange some items for others with PMCs. Keep in mind that the items offered by corporations have a fixed value and can be expensive. The items accepted depend on the station where the exchange takes place and may change over time. Current required items can be viewed in the station description. The game works on the principle of Supply and Demand, stations use the items they receive to produce goods, and then sell them to other stations in the system. Because of this the price of bartered items can change greatly. You can view current prices and their dynamics in the second tab of the Stock Exchange. To exchange without having to visit stations, you can enable Fast Trade in the settings.

Trade break
If your reputation with a faction falls beyond 0 they will null all your accumulated barter points with them.

Actions
There are special conditions in the game like eating, moving, or using actions. Actions in this case include: using inventory, reloading weapons, throwing weapons, throwing grenades, interacting with doors and interactable objects (scanner, autodoc, stove, workbench), using pact abilities.

Weapon range and character range
Weapon range indicates the optimal operating range of the weapon. If the enemy is outside of it then the additional properties of the weapon will not work and for each tile beyond the range the damage received will be reduced. The character's range shows the range of vision.

Equipment and repairs
Weapons and armor wear down over time. If you repair them using various spare parts rather than specialized equipment then with each repair their maximum condition will decrease. Because of this weapons can become completely unusable.

Shift and Ctrl in inventory
Moving an item while holding Shift will transfer all items of that type. If you hold down Ctrl and left-click on an item, it will be transferred from or to the inventory.

Amputations
Amputations are the most severe type of injury. It can’t be healed, only stabilized, temporarily removing damage over time but not the unpleasant effects. Some body parts are tied to each other: hip and foot, shoulder and arm. When amputating the upper part of the body, the lower adjacent part is also amputated. The vital parts of the body are the head, chest, body, and stomach. Their amputation leads to instant death.

Where are quasimorphs
The presence of quasimorphs is indicated in the description of the planets. The satellites of the planets are also influenced by the bramfaturas of the respective planets. The exception is the Moon which has its own bramfatura and affects the celestial bodies nearby. At the beginning of the game there are no quasimorphs on Earth and its artificial satellite Tsiolkovsky, as well as on Mars, Phobos, and Deimos. There are no quasimorphosis or eccolapse on Defense missions.

Breaking walls
All man-made walls can be broken if enough damage is dealt.

Puddles
Any liquids (water, blood, gasoline, poison) can leave behind puddles. If the new puddle is larger or the same size as the old one then the new puddle will replace the old one. Spilled gasoline may ignite due to fire nearby. Puddles of poison are considered Dangerous Tiles and dry up over time. Puddles of poison will destroy any items dropped onto them excluding pacts and quest items.

Fire and items
If a floor tile with raw meat catches fire the meat will become fried. Any other items other than quest items and pacts will be destroyed.

Add. damaging elements
Weapons with the “Add. damaging elements” property will deal damage to everyone standing next to a cover destroyed by it.

Add. knockback range
Weapons with the “Add. knockback range” property push away the target they hit further than any other weapon.

Amputation due to injury
Weapons with “Amputation due to injury” property have an increased chance of causing amputation as a wound.

Silencer
Weapons with the “Silencer” property have a chance of not attracting the attention of nearby enemies when fired.

Pierce Chance
Ammo with the “Pierce Chance” property has a chance to pass through an obstacle, be it cover or an enemy, and hit the target behind it.

Pollution Chance
Ammo with the “Pollution Chance” property has a chance to leave behind a dangerous tile of the corresponding type.

Pain Damage
Weapons with the “Pain Damage” property increase damage to the pain threshold.

Severe fractures
Fracture wounds inflicted by weapons with the “Severe Fractures” property have increased damage.

Severe bleeding
Bleeding wounds inflicted by weapons with the “Severe Bleeding” property have increased damage.

Attacks nearby
Weapons with the “Attacks nearby” property also strike the left and right tiles closest to the player on both sides of the target.

Throwing weapons
If you left-click on an enemy while holding Shift at a distance while holding a melee weapon the clone will throw that weapon at the target. The maximum range of melee weapons is 5 tiles starting from the clone tile.

Accurate throw
Throwing a weapon with the “Accurate Throw” property will always hit the target.

Piercing Throw
When thrown, weapons with the “Piercing Throw” property can pass through a target and cause damage to targets behind it.

Wound-inflicting pierce through
Weapons with the “Wound-inflicting pierce through” property inflict a wound if the attack pierce through the enemy. The chance of pierce through can be viewed in the ammo properties.

Backup Gun
Weapons with the “Backup Gun” property increase the chance of a critical hit by the listed value for weapons in other slots.

Ramp Up Shot
Weapons with the “Ramp Up Shot” property increase their rate of fire when firing continuously.

Painful Critical Hits
Weapons with the “Painful Critical Hits” property inflict increased pain on critical hits.

Increased Damage Through Armor
Against weapons with the “Increased Damage Through Armor” property, armor cannot reduce incoming damage by more than 95% minus listed value.

Field of View
Weapons with the “Field of View” property modifies the clone’s Field of View to the specified value, increasing or decreasing it.

The phenomenon in which a creature is torn from the inside and a Quasimorph appears in its place is called an <color=#FFFEC1>eccolapse</color>. On the first turn the newly appeared Quasimorph is invulnerable, it phases between our and their realities. At this moment, it makes no sense to fire at it, it’s better to take a tactically more advantageous position.

Valuable items such as production chips and mercenary mind chips justify the costs of using the shuttle. If you find something like this on a mission, we can evacuate you as part of the standard procedure using the elevator or shuttle.

Injuries are common in combat situations. The first priority is to treat the wound. You can use bandages, splints, or even ordinary rags for that. To obtain a rag, tear up any unnecessary clothing. Autodocs and surgical kits allow you to immediately heal any wound.
Some wounds can become infected. To prevent this, use sorbent or antibiotics.

Your body constantly requires calories for normal functioning. When satiety drops to zero, the atrophy process begins, which continually reduces your health. Simply eat something. Keep in mind that cannibalism is not encouraged but not prohibited, so if you have melee weapons, you can resort to it.
Almost any weapon consumes ammunition and need to be reloaded. Avoid doing this in the midst of battle because you become vulnerable during the reloading process. Try to find cover.
Weapons have a tendency to break with regular and active use. To repair them, you can disassemble other unnecessary weaponry or use a repair kit.

Your backpack has torn. I'll remind you this time but try to keep an eye on the condition of your equipment yourself. Contents will constantly spill out from a torn backpack or rig. To repair it, use any available fabric.

Enemies can also use offensive grenades. Of course, they do it much worse than our operatives, but there are exceptions. To avoid getting hit by shrapnel, it's better to move to a safe distance and find cover.

Since we conduct illegal activities, trade transactions between corporations and participants in the dignitas market are not available to us. But given our influence on the Solar System, corporations are ready to barter with us.

Different stations require different goods, as soon as we bring them and unload them into the station warehouse, the station owners will be happy to exchange them for some of their own items. The course is certainly extortionate, but it's worth it.

The capacity of our mother spacecraft allows us to produce items directly on board. To produce most simple items, we only need a licensed chip.

There are examples in history of how one corporation tried to introduce an additional fee for each item produced, but as a result of the six-day war, the corporation went bankrupt, and all the others refused such monetization.

<color=#FFFEC1>Clones</color> often die on missions, there's nothing to be done about it, but on the other hand, any clone can be reprinted on a <color=#FFFEC1>bioprinter</color>. Plus, we have <color=#FFFEC1>insurance</color> for such cases, which partially compensates for the lost equipment. To do this, find the <color=#FFFEC1>Emergency Case</color> in the Magnum's inventory, right-click on it, and select <color=#FFFEC1>dismantle</color>.

This device is a communication jammer, EW-thing, interfering transmitter, name it. It jams some of the communication channels between you and Magnum. Therefore, we cannot send you station minimaps. If you destroy the jammer, the channels will be free and the minimap will be accessible. So don't hesitate, shoot.
Careful! There are acid puddles next to you. They are difficult to notice but they are extremely dangerous. Avoid them or let them dry.

This is the <color=#FFFEC1>HIS Magnum</color> control screen. From here you can access the list of clone operators and the Cargo Hold (Top right corner of the screen). To go to the ship's compartments click on any compartment marker.

This is a list of weapon modification projects. Here you can select the weapon whose chip you have unlocked and improve its characteristics. Keep in mind that the price of modification is growing exponentially, and the number of projects is limited.

This is a list of armor modification projects. Here you can select the armor whose chip you have unlocked and improve its characteristics. Keep in mind that the price of modification is growing exponentially, and the number of projects is limited.

This is a list of class development projects. Here you can select a class and replace its perks with the perks of any other unlocked class. Keep in mind that the development price increases exponentially depending on the number of perks being replaced, and the number of projects is limited.

The barter module allows you to load a trade shuttle and send it to any body of the Solar System. Select a planet or a satellite, look at the required items by the stations, load them via the “Trade Shuttle” under the list of stations and send the shuttle. In a few days it will return with the items received after the barter.

This is a list of clone development projects. Here you can choose a clone of the operator whose chip you unlocked and improve its characteristics or even change their personal perk. Keep in mind that the price of development is growing exponentially, and the number of projects is limited.
This is a list of operators undergoing training to level up their class perks. The available maximum level for training depends on the unlocked module upgrades.

Welcome to the Quasimorph Early Access! Please remember that the game is actively in development, and the current version does not have all the planned features. You can find information about our upcoming plans on the game's page and in the game's main menu.

And don't forget about bug reports! Most likely, we are already working on fixes but you can help by reporting bugs through the dedicated section in the main menu.

Hop into our Discord to discuss the game with us and other players, and receive updates before everyone else.

Supplies on the spacecraft are running low, so we need to find some new profitable <color=#FFFEC1>contracts</color>. We can start working for anyone and make them the dominant power in the System, or we can try to maintain the status quo for the sake of long term profiting from this apocalypse. We can start by returning the <color=#FFFEC1>AnСom's PCPU</color> from our cargo hold to its rightful owners. Or bring it to someone else. Also, if we can land a mighty blow on <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color>, there is a chance that he has enemies on <color=#FFFEC1>Venus</color> and they will contact us. It's up to you, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>.

Good morning, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>. Let's first restore memory after the diapause. During the AnCom mission on Venus, we awakened a quasimorph named <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color>. Now his quasimorphs are still in our world, which is weird. There's no information in the news that we're involved.. Meanwhile, corporates insist that quasimorphosis is a fabrication and claim that <color=#FFFEC1>Tezctlan</color> is a provocation by <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color>. We are now orbiting <color=#FFFEC1>Phobos</color> and have time to recover and figure out what to do next. The supplies on the spacecraft are running low, so we need to find ourselves some new profitable...

<color=#FFFEC1>ATTENTION! ATTENTION!</color> Vector 4, sector 6, northern hemisphere. Five launches detected, rocket engines. Approaching rapidly. Activating countermeasures. <color=#FFFEC1>"Magnum"</color>, grab onto something - it's going to be loud.
It seems to be <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color>. We need to clear them out from <color=#FFFEC1>"Magnum"</color>. Our future depends on it.

English: Leave the cabin and head to the <color=#FFFEC1>elevator</color>, it's in the room across. We need to eliminate all these bastards.

If you press key {0}, you can get information about the <color=#FFFEC1>mission status</color> or request <color=#FFFEC1>evacuation</color>. <color=#FFFEC1>Evacuation</color> is done via elevator or shuttle. But right now, we have nowhere to retreat...

To move between station levels, use <color=#FFFEC1>elevators</color> or <color=#FFFEC1>stairs</color>. In the elevator control window, all floors connected by the elevator shaft are displayed. Press the floor you need. I strongly recommend starting with the <color=#FFFEC1>Medbay</color>. If we lose the <color=#FFFEC1>bioprinter</color>, there will be serious difficulties in cloning you or other fighters.

This is the <color=#FFFEC1>Medbay</color>, where the <color=#FFFEC1>bioprinter</color> is located. A perfect place to remind you about your health. If your health reaches zero, you will die. If your pain threshold reaches its limit, you will skip a turn. Damage you receive can lead to injuries or limb loss. Keep an eye on that. Take a close look at the health interface by pressing the {0} key.
I'm sending a signal to your computer about a new <color=#FFFEC1>wound</color>; you need to fix it. To do this, press {0} on the medical kit to your right, then select the injured body part.

It seems you've acquired an <color=#FFFEC1>infection</color>. Open your inventory by pressing {0} and use a <color=#FFFEC1>sorbent</color> or <color=#FFFEC1>antibiotic</color>. If the wound is not fixed, the <color=#FFFEC1>infection</color> develops faster.

In extreme cases, you can perform an <color=#FFFEC1>amputation</color>. To do this, select 'amputate' in the context menu of a <color=#FFFEC1>sharp object</color> and choose the <color=#FFFEC1>body part</color>. Note that you can't bandage yourself while in sprint mode.

<color=#FFFEC1>AutoDoc</color> allows you to treat wounds or infections if it has <color=#FFFEC1>charges</color>. You can recharge it with standard <color=#FFFEC1>batteries</color>. Hurry, I've spotted an <color=#FFFEC1>enemy</color> in the room below you. Deal with them.

Great job. Pay attention to the body. Click on it to <color=#FFFEC1>loot</color>. If you want to <color=#FFFEC1>stand on the corpse</color> without inspecting it, use {0} for movement. When you're done here, return to the elevator and descend to the next level. In the top right corner, there's a <color=#FFFEC1>minimap</color> and the current <color=#FFFEC1>mission status</color>. Use these buttons if you forget what's happening.

And here's our <color=#FFFEC1>arsenal</color>. Ammo and melee weapons have different <color=#FFFEC1>damage types</color>, and armor has different <color=#FFFEC1>resistance types</color>. Choose wisely with what and how to attack to win.

column1: 2つの<color=#FFFEC1>武器スロット</color>があります。左上のアクティブな武器の画像をクリックするか、キー{1}を使用して素早く切り替えることができます。
English:
让我们确保你的武器已经装填好，随时可以参与战斗。重新装填武器，请按 {0} 键。如果子弹是在屏幕中央的战术背心槽里，按下相应的快速访问槽键。这样再把武器装填好所需花的回合会少得多。

你有两个武器槽。你可以通过点击左上角的活动武器图像或使用按键 {1} 快速切换它们。

I suggest hiding behind the cover to make it harder for enemies to hit us. To do this, stand on the highlighted square.

The cover can stop a bullet if you're not shooting directly from behind it. If your shooting trajectory intersects the cover, it will be highlighted in red.

column1: Die <color=#FFFEC1>Deckung</color> kann eine Kugel stoppen, wenn du nicht direkt von dahinter schießt. Wenn deine Schussbahn die Deckung kreuzt, wird sie rot markiert.
English:
Je suggère de se mettre à l'abri derrière la couverture pour que les ennemis aient moins de facilité à nous toucher. Pour ce faire, placez-vous sur la case en surbrillance.

La couverture peut arrêter une balle si vous ne tirez pas directement derrière lui. Si la trajectoire de tir croise l'abri, il sera mis en surbrillance en rouge.

column1: 假如你不直接从<color=#FFFEC1>掩体</color>的后面射击，其可以挡子弹。如果弹道与掩体相交，它将以红亮显示。

English:
Great. Here's some more useful information. If you ever want to shoot somewhere other than the enemy, hold {0}. Your cursor will change to a crosshair, and the shooting trajectory will be displayed.
We have a fuel barrel for the flamethrower; you can blow it up with a shot... Just don't catch fire yourself. Fire is very dangerous!
To the right of the active weapon is the button to select the <color=#FFFEC1>shooting mode</color>. Hover the cursor over it to see the advantages and disadvantages of each.

Someone threw <color=#FFFEC1>grenades</color> into the Machine Room again; I'll deal with them later. <color=#FFFEC1>Grenades</color> are used from the <color=#FFFEC1>utility belt slots</color>. Activate grenade usage with the corresponding hotkey or pressing {0}. Once you're done here, head to the <color=#FFFEC1>cubecentric engine</color> on the left.

Colnodes have barricaded themselves in the upper compartment. Get ready for a serious battle. Use cover and don't play the hero. We have several stationary turrets and mines. They are used in the same way: from the inventory with {0}. Opening the context menu, you need to select ‘use’. Turret or mine in this case will be installed in the cell next to you - in the direction you are facing. Prepare for defense; we have a little time.

Just in case, the key for skipping a turn is {1}. It might be useful if you need to wait for a few turns.
Destroy them before they blow up the <color=#FFFEC1>Cubecentric Engine!</color> Use everything I've already told you, the goal is to protect the <color=#FFFEC1>‘Magnum’</color>.
Well done, <color=#FFFEC1>Frank</color>. All invaders eliminated, and <color=#FFFEC1>‘Magnum’</color> is no longer under threat. See you at the <color=#FFFEC1>Bridge</color>. Over and out.

We can certainly do as <color=#FFFEC1>Jane</color> said. Contracts are waiting. But as the saying goes: <color=#FFFEC1>'Honor is lost, everything is lost; honor is preserved, everything is preserved.'</color>. We were able to track down the exact locations of the shuttlepods launches - it's <color=#FFFEC1>Rogue City</color>. Most likely, <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> has set up a training center and a transshipment point there. Before we start chasing money, I suggest to stick a red-hot poker in the red's ass.

Great, I'm glad that honor is not an empty word to you, <color=#FFFEC1>Boss</color>. Just in case, I'll remind you about the standard mission preparation interface. On this screen, you choose the operative who will go on the mission, the chip with combat skills that will be integrated into the freshly printed clone, and the equipment that we will issue to the fighter for the mission.

This is the <color=#FFFEC1>bioprinter screen</color>. Here you can choose a fighter to go on a mission. The list includes both those who survived previous missions and those who need to be printed. Each of the fighters has their own parameters and unique <color=#FFFEC1>talent</color>. They have all been through a lot during years of combat in every corner of the <color=#FFFEC1>Solar System</color>.

This is the <color=#FFFEC1>class selection screen</color>. In addition to their own experience, each fighter will benefit from gaining a specific set of skills based on the experience of past military conflicts and digitized experience of special forces. Each <color=#FFFEC1>class</color> has a set of passive abilities and trigger abilities that are activated under certain conditions.

Now you need to <color=#FFFEC1>gather your equipment</color>. Take whatever you deem necessary, but don't forget ammo, food, and medical supplies. Note that if the operative you send dies in battle, all the items will be lost, and <color=#FFFEC1>evacuation</color> is only possible when the <color=#FFFEC1>mission is completed</color> or we find something valuable like a new <color=#FFFEC1>consciousness chip</color>.
Great, if you feel ready, it's time to press the <color=#FFFEC1>Start Mission</color> button.

Our scanners see several ways to solve this problem. First, there is the main <color=#FFFEC1>elevator</color> connecting the <color=#FFFEC1>Cargo Dock</color> to the <color=#FFFEC1>Control Center</color>, but the number of biosignatures at the <color=#FFFEC1>elevator</color> is extremely high. Obviously, there is a quite <color=#FFFEC1>strong security</color> there. Secondly, there is a bypass route through the <color=#FFFEC1>stairs and warehouse level</color>. I would recommend using the second option as our main plan, but if you feel confident, you can act as you think best.

Some room nearby is an <color=#FFFEC1>Elevator</color>. Be careful, the signatures of stationary turrets and heavily armored <color=#FFFEC1>colnodes</color> are clearly tracked there. Whatever kills them can kill you too. You are not special, and equipment tends to run out.

This <color=#FFFEC1>stairs</color> leads to the warehouse premises. We have enhanced the resolution capability of the geoscanner, there's medical supplies and some other equipment there. Use everything, and you will easily reach the <color=#FFFEC1>SD control center</color>.

Finally, you're at the <color=#FFFEC1>SD control center</color>. It's full of <color=#FFFEC1>Civil Resistance</color> fighters. A bioscanner is registering spikes in their endocrine systems - it's madness. Maybe there's a way to bypass them? Pay attention to the technical corridors and ventilation shafts. If you picked up <color=#FFFEC1>heavy weaponry</color> from the warehouse, you shouldn't have many problems. Once you find their <color=#FFFEC1>PCO control computer</color>, just destroy it with whatever's at hand.

Great job. Pilots began maneuver as soon as the geoscanner beeped that the <color=#FFFEC1>Rogue City</color> guns died. Mission accomplished. Request <color=#FFFEC1>evacuation</color> and return to the nearest <color=#FFFEC1>elevator</color>.

In front of you, there is a map of the <color=#FFFEC1>Solar System</color>. Here you can see which <color=#FFFEC1>missions</color> are available in different areas and how much <color=#FFFEC1>time it will take to travel</color> from one point to another. Right now, to deliver the PCPU with quasimorphic research to <color=#FFFEC1>AnCom</color>, we need to go to <color=#FFFEC1>Mars</color>. Boss... One more thing. The system is open to us and full of possibilities. You are under no obligation to return the device to its rightful owner. But I wouldn’t risk getting involved with <color=#FFFEC1>AnCom</color>. And... This is the last piece of advice that I gave you.

Choose the <color=#FFFEC1>Rebus Sky City</color> to visit. It's a <color=#FFFEC1>peaceful station</color>, so there's no need to equip the operative who will go there. Also, when we send clones to perform <color=#FFFEC1>barter</color>, we load all the items into the shuttle, so there's no need to make multiple trips if something is forgotten. When you are ready, take the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color> with the research and send the operative.

Have you brought us our <color=#FFFEC1>intellectual property</color>? Great. Find our representative here at the station and deliver the <color=#FFFEC1>PCPU</color>. To do this, click on the <color=#FFFEC1>pile of boxes</color> next to him. Place the PCPU in the opened inventory window and press the <color=#FFFEC1>“Exchange”</color> button. This is how <color=#FFFEC1>barter</color> works at all peaceful stations where you are allowed to land. When you’re done, return to the shuttle and get out of here.

Good work, <color=#FFFEC1>mercenary</color>. If you need contracts, we regularly distribute them through the <color=#FFFEC1>SBN</color> channels. Work for us and you will become rich. But if you stand in our way, the consequences will be dreadful. I hope we understood each other.

I can't stand these corporates... Boss, what next? It seems like you and Frank have satisfied your sense of justice. We're free now. There's chaos all over the System. Taking advantage of the sudden appearance of quasimorphs, the corporations have reshuffled the market. Stations change owners almost every day. Tezctlan, who seems to favor us for its awakening, is squeezing the corporations on Venus. Civil Resistance has been showing some furious activity around Mars. Maybe we should continue fighting against them if we get paid for it? There's no quasimorphosis there, so it will be easier.

We can start working for anyone and make them the mighty power in the System, or we can try to maintain the status quo for the sake of long-term profit from this apocalypse. Also we can decide that Tezctlan is too big a threat to all humanity. We can start fighting against him, hoping that someone will join us. It's up to you, Boss.

Is that you? I remember you. I've been waiting, hoping that you would show up again. And here you are. You've come close enough to Gannix for my call to reach your mind. But this proximity is not enough for us to make a pact. Do not fear, it will be beneficial for both of us. We have something to offer each other. Do you know why Quasimorphosis occurs in the solid realm? Why the barons come to you? To meet me, go to Venus and simply do your job. Massacre them the way you always do. Murders, cannibalism, people screaming in agony. I will sense the sweet aroma of Gavvakh, and I will know it's you. And I will come to you in person. Then we will discuss the terms of our alliance.

Oh yeah, I'm coming. Agony, the cries of the dying, pain leaving your bodies with the blood - all this in the solid realm looks very different inside Gannix. To us, it is a sweet-voiced choir of ecstasy. Gavvakh flows out of your bodies with blood, torment, and life itself. It streams through your realm and seeps into ours. And we can drink it. Taltnoms crave Gavvakh. Taltnoms want Gavvakh.

Gavvakh gives us power. Once we are satiated with Gavvakh, we can tear through the invisible fabric separating our realm from yours. First, we whisper to you. Then, we tempt you. Then, we change you. And finally, when you have been turned into our servants and Gavvakh is flowing, we can reveal ourselves. We do not lose our immortality. Our death in Kenom is merely an exile back to Gannix.

So when you killed me on Mercury, I did not die. Accept my gift, and we will make a pact. You will become my servant. I will give you the power to resist Tezctlan and protect the solid realm, your realm. Now finish the job you came here for. I will help you.
I granted you the Skull of the Feathered Serpent so that you could make a pact with me. It is already on the way to your Ethereal Ship

Finally! You have kept your end of the bargain. From now on, we are bound by an unbreakable pact. Together, we will destroy Tezctlan. We must do this! Once a freedom fighter, first among equals in the emerald crystal of Gannix, the king has gone mad. He must be stopped. He dreams of the Emerald Empire, wishes to expand it beyond Gannix. But he himself had once fought against an insane tyrant possessed by the same delusions.

I will stay in your realm, on Venus. I will gather the Taltnoms loyal to Liberty and fight the madman here. You must head to Mars. There's a place you call Sinkhole Oasis. It's an ancient battlefield. Long before a human ancestor looked up to the stars in fear, a battle took place there. Tezctlan himself took part in it. He emerged victorious, but there he lost his spear. Itzpapalotl, the symbol of the ruler's fate in the Emerald Kingdom, was forever cast on Mars. If you acquire this spear, it is with its help that you will be able to defeat the madman. For your realm, it is salvation from the monster, for Gannix, it is the path to freedom."

Fool! I am Tezctlan, the emperor of eternal Gannix, the lord of the boundless Emerald Empire, the scourge cutting the thread of fate, the leader of legions flying the banners of eagle, jaguar, boa constrictor, and caiman! I am the one who has experienced worship, I am the one who will take Gagtungr's place, I am the one who is truly worthy to rule the Solar System. I am the punishment sent by the universe. Bow your head, mortal. Submit. Accept your fate. In a realm devoid of the golden light of the Sun, the green radiance of Gannix will bring life and death.

Magnum, listen up. This is the head of security at the Sinkhole Oasis geological station. I'm speaking on behalf of the RealWare Corporation. RealWare is committed to the open market and NCE regulations, unlike you. Your visit to the station is not in our interest. You have nothing to offer us. If you don't change course within the next 30 seconds, the artillery of our planetary defense system will blast your HIS to atoms. The countdown starts. Over and out.

Translating from corporate to human, Boss. There's definitely something beyond the scope of the geological station's work at Sinkhole Oasis. RealWare will only let us in if they trust us enough. We'll have to do some work for them if we really need to get in there."

This is a peaceful visit, weapons are prohibited. However, RealWare trusts us enough to let us wander around the station in search of something interesting. We've switched Magnum's geoscanner to passive mode to avoid drawing unnecessary attention. So, search the old-fashioned way. Maybe there's a poorly guarded emergency exit or something. Lady Xiomara sent us here for a reason. Be careful, remember that you literally shoved your arm into RealWare's mouth.

Yes, this is what we've been looking for. The staircase leads to the inner chambers, and it seems there's no alarm here. We can infiltrate the place relatively unnoticed. However, if you run into any security operatives, they will shoot to kill. Stay cautious and only go down after you're ready for a combat mission.
The owner of the station will do not like if you use this backdoor. You should better stay in the safety zone.

We're utilizing the surprise effect to its fullest. Our techies have hacked into Sinkhole Oasis servers and are overloading its network with information noise. You have some time to figure out what's going on here. Find the spear Lady Xiomara mentioned, and gather any valuable data if possible.

What do you see? When you switched to direct actions, we activated the geoscanner. As soon as we scanned the room you're in, it froze up, outputting data that gave our operator a seizure. What on earth is in there? No wonder RealWare is so diligently filtering access to Sinkhole Oasis. Maybe you need to destroy this bloody thing and retrieve the spear from it.

Well, that was a bad idea. A very bad idea. Firstly, you didn't budge a single atom of this thing with your shot. Secondly, the alarm went off. All armed RealWare security operatives are heading your way. We need some information on this Monolith. Gather it, and we'll get you out.
Excellent, this data should suffice. We didn't get the spear, but we can plan our next moves. Return to the elevator; we'll figure out a way to get you out. Let's hope for the best.
We managed to come up with some excuses, but RealWare still suspects us. Our reputation has been compromised.

The data we acquired suggests that this entire Monolith is nothing but a phased feature. But first of all, this event occurred about a billion years ago, and secondly, it completely defies the laws of our universe. We're not the first to try breaking it. RealWare has tried every weapon available to them, including a controlled nuclear blast. The result has always been the same - no result. Looks like we have nothing...

Exactly. You understand NOTHING! This is a priceless find. The Monolith not only phased into our realm from the bramfatura of Mars, but at the time of phasing, it was something entirely different than just a stone. Your problems won't be solved by anyone other than Dr. Eipshwitz. Since I'm now traveling on your spacecraft, can I finally be considered your employee? Let's get closer to mutually beneficial cooperation. NCE. Freedom to contract. Remember?

Well, well... I'll need my Telefaturic Dislocator, several boxes of spare parts and repair kits, and I'll need a lab space on the ship and a lab coat... Ah, no. No coat needed. But a couple of handy assistants are.

Where did I put the Dislocator? You didn't take it back from Mercury? Hm... seems it should still be at Flat Obsidian, in the field camp. We need to evacuate it from there so I can get to work.

I distinctly remember it standing right here! It was stolen! Those filthy colnodian hands think they have the right to touch my property? This is very fragile and infinitely valuable equipment! Search the whole damn station, it's gotta be here somewhere. I need i… I mean, we need it!

What?! Barbarians. Vandals. One, two, three, four, ten, sixty-two. The Dislocator was perfectly dismantled into four parts! Four! Even a colnode with one hand and no thumb can count to four! These idiots have destroyed a masterpiece of human thought! They've pushed all modern science back to the Stone Age! I'll have to start development practically from scratch again. So... I need alloys, microchips, nails... Yeah, maybe four or eight this time? We need to consider our previous experience... Yes... Hm...

Embraced by the mission of the Blood Warriors, from the beginning we know the Realm of Ur, a realm that lies beyond the boundaries of the physical universe. This is our true fatherland. We know Urparp, guardian of the Bright Throne of Gagtungr. To Him we give the glory that comes from our mouth. We also know the created realm. To it we send our curses. We serve the Conqueror Worm, who bestowed the title of Blood Warriors upon us. From the beginning, we remember Him, the father of our spirit, the Ancient Terror for the Manifested Realm. Embraced by the mission of the Blood Warriors, from the beginning we feel Enkidu, rising through us from the bonds of Creation.
Warriors! We were born to die on the battlefield. Our flesh is bound in steel to the will of Lord Urparp! Death to the enemies of the Lord!"

I'm making a cautious assumption that our invasion of Sinkhole Oasis triggered some mechanisms similar to what we've seen on Venus before... I highly doubt, Boss, that what we are doing will benefit us or humanity.

I guess the doctor will be incapable of normal human communication for a while. Anyway, let's try to grab anything even remotely resembling "a true work of art" and get you out of there. Looks like colnode reinforcements have arrived, so we'll have to fight our way back again.

I've seen things you people wouldn't believe… Myriads of Demons on fire off the shell of Ur… I watched ancient rituals that glitter in the dark near the Red and Gold Throne. All those moments will be lost in time, like specks of dust in the Red Desert… Time to die.

I am a god! How can you kill a god? What a magnificent, dizzying innocence! How could you be so naive?! My shackled consciousness is now free, my kingdom is awakening with me. The hour of war is coming, human.
We lost contact with you precisely for... 48.1 minutes. Whatever you've seen or encountered, we need to evacuate you and the spear. Take it and get back to the elevator.

Greetings, mercenary. We have been monitoring your HIS whenever possible. While evaluating your usefulness, we wanted to be able to contact you immediately. The time has come. You might be interested in another short-term contract. The task is simple: reclaim our property once again. You have shown that you are quite good at it. The mission target: <color=#FFFEC1>Oddibjord-3</color> colony on <color=#FFFEC1>Venus</color>. All the details have already been uploaded to the Magnum. You can start whenever you are ready. End of transmission.

Boss, the digital sequences of the contract issued to us by <color=#FFFEC1>AnCom</color> are partially generated or rewritten. If I may say, the contract looks somewhat suspicious. It is likely that the mission is not about reclaiming, but rather seizing someone else’s property. Considering that most of the assets on Venus previously belonged to the <color=#FFFEC1>Fresco</color> corporation, I suspect we are after something from their advanced research. This is a tempting target for many. Thus, we may find ourselves at the center of a conflict among several corporations.

These are <color=#FFFEC1>RealWare</color> operatives, Boss. Signatures are disabled, but everything is clear here. I bet they're looking for the same thing that we are. I'll take a long sip from my "I told you so" mug while I'll be sending this data to AnCom. Let's see their reaction.

We confirm this is a small task force of RealWare Sec fighters. Their corporate transponders are turned off which means they are not covered by NCE. Such episodes among the hexarchs are rare, but this is a good chance to obtain information about the true balance of power in the System.

To facilitate the fulfillment of the contract we dropped two autonomous capsules with resources and promising prototypes from the “Unmasked.” A great opportunity for you to complete the mission, and for us to conduct field tests. The main goal of the contract does not change. We don't see anything you can't handle.

I detect the signal! You're still alive. The elevator collapsed to the lower level of Oddibjord-3. The device must be <color=#FFFEC1>somewhere nearby</color>. I detect very powerful bursts of quasimorphic activity throughout the entire floor. Looks like you'll have to fight your way out.

Why are violence and sanctity so intertwined? Why is death necessary for life to continue? The master warned that someone would come for the <color=#FFFEC1>Crystal Skull</color>. And he even predicted that it would be the messenger of the one thanks to whom he came to life again in your world. I'm not sorry that you decided to turn your weapons against <color=#FFFEC1>the Emerald Emperor</color>. Your blood will give me new power.

There must be a quasimorphic artifact nearby. Take it and return to the shuttle. This is exactly what we were sent for. <color=#FFFEC1>RealWare</color> reinforcements are arriving to Oddibjord-3, you need to get out of there quickly.

I broadcast on an open channel. You are good for a mercenary. You should have thought about collaborating with RealWare. AnCom are murderers and scammers. It's too late now. The entire sector is under our control, this time you will be eliminated before the task is completed.
Open channel. It's a pleasure doing business with you. Our soldiers have not received such combat experience since the Calypso incident. I hope you're not going to give up. Over and out.

When you'll get to the ground level <color=#FFFEC1>immediately</color> move towards the shuttle. RealWare reinforcements have already taken up defensive positions along the entire perimeter. There are a lot of them there. Pull yourself together and do the best you can.

Attention, <color=#FFFEC1>HIS «Unmasked»</color> is speaking! «Magnum», we have to inform you that the mission has been <color=#FFFEC1>cancelled</color>. Unfortunately, the contractual obligations will be revoked. We observe a large concentration of the enemy in the mission area. A decision was made to launch a tactical nuclear strike. Goal: protection of intellectual property of AnCom corporation. The costs are considered justified. Your presence in Oddibjord-3 from now on is considered a violation of the AnCom Information Security Protocol. Public Declaration Article 12, Section C, Paragraph 3. Over and out.

Sensors detected the activation of the HIS «Unmasked» thrusters. This is an AnCom ship in orbit around Venus. The approximation shows reaching the position for dropping the bomb from orbit on Oddibjord-3. They don't have enough time to aim accurately, so you'll be hit only with debris, a shock front, and EMP. Bastards. Run to the shuttle and don't break the damn thing.
You can make a phase bomb. It may be used as an usual grenade, but Eipschwitz did this for something completely different.
An escape pod has been dispatched and should land somewhere nearby.
Error! Failed to generate level. Please, send a report through the Main Menu.
Do you want to leave your obligations under the PMC contract?
You will lose your save. Continue?
The operator equipment has not been selected! Do you want to start a mission?
All class progress will be lost. Do you want to change the operator class?
The pact with the Quasimorph will be impossible to break in the usual way, it will remain in effect even after the death of the operative.
The pact with the Quasimorph will be terminated, this action cannot be undone.
Access is denied. The information is classified.
You should not have come here. Shartamakhum contemplates. Shartamakhum is waiting. Shartamakhum is preparing for war. Prepare for eternal lamentation in my womb, Gavvakh!
Finally! Master, do you hear? I used mortal blood and answered the call! Mortal, prepare to become a part of my power!
You simply have to accept that your demons are a part of you. You have to accept them as your friends.
Duggur... You opened it... I have arrived... When I consume your power, please do not cry. Tears are but a futile waste of good suffering.
Every war has its demons. Your war now has me!

There are some items on the ground, are you sure to leave station?
The history of humanity is written in tears and blood.
Liars, tyrants, idealists - they all tried to bring happiness on the edge of a sword.
We waited for liberation from the shackles of fate and were ready to go through the Last Judgment for it.
Not for the glorious death for the Eternal Kingdom, Love, or the Lord, but for a way to step off the path of suffering.
But when the Apocalypse came, we shrugged our shoulders and started profiting from it as usual.
The creatures lurking in the depths of space didn't seem scarier than our own world.
Armed with the hope that the darkest hour comes before dawn, we try to survive until the first rays of the Sun...
Bleed is a very dangerous state. It's recommended to care about it.
Wow, you can see the Orion Arm from here
Actions performed by broken limbs cause tremendous pain
Actions performed by broken limbs cause tremendous pain
Stomach Damage due to damage from eating
The progression of the infection leads to serious illnesses
The result of a poisonous substance entering the body
Enhance Q-morphos events and cause hallucinations
Seems like one more is not a crime tho
A constant urge to unwind with a cigarette
Result of exposure of the body to ionizing radiation
Follow safety rules when working with electricity
Intoxication with ethyl alcohol leads to a dissipation of attention, slower reactions, and decreased coordination of movements.
With every consecutive shot the rate of fire increases.

In the 2150s, terraforming equipment was delivered to Mercury. The surface temperature is still far from adequate for humans. However, automatic stations can operate on the surface. The inhabitants of Mercury are robots. It is reported that humans can work in tunnels beneath the surface and inside mountain ranges. Some corporations are rumored to already have such colonies.

Quasimorphic status: Due to the weak presence of humans, Shartamakhum is almost inactive.

The planet was intensively terraformed at the end of the 21st century. All the power of a few wealthy corporations was directed towards this task. Bombardment with ice chunks, contamination of the soil with GMO bacteria, sowing of GMO seeds, and then colonization of GMO animals (mostly insects and spiders) were undertaken. Venus has been terraformed for 70 years. Moreover, people almost did not control the second stage of the process. The upper layers of the planet's atmosphere became a toxic hotbed (with the surface completely habitable) under which the jungle grew. Poisonous swamps still encircle the planet at the equator but otherwise, it is the most habitable after the Earth.

Quasimorphic status: the mass construction of cities under geodesic domes (geodesics) led to the awakening of Gannix and the widespread phasing of its elements on the surface of the planet. Quasimorphic activity here is extremely high, so all studies of this phenomenon here gave particularly effective results. Now the Quasimorphs of Gannix are full-fledged participants in the struggle for the Solar System, which is strictly hidden by the Hexarchy.

Earth is the ecological and agrarian paradise of humanity. According to the information from the SBN, the Earth is inhabited by 4 billion people. After the construction of New Seattle on the Moon and Intercity on Mars, the interdict mode stands on the planet.

Interdict mode: Only those market agents who are employees of corporations that have property on Earth or market agents that own such property have permission to visit the Earth.

A satellite of the Earth, on which it is possible to extract helium-3 with high efficiency and produce quantum liquid H-3 from it. This is the fuel for cubecentric engines (the main engine type for spacecrafts). On the Moon, there is a huge pressurized city of New Seattle, which houses the headquarters and other buildings of a huge number of corporations. In New Seattle, there is the "Source" building, which houses servers that maintain the up-to-date text of the NCE and other related documents.

Quasimorphic status: Duggur is a dark and poorly studied Bramfatura. Quasimorphs on the Moon rarely attack New Seattle for some reason. However, there are rumors that the city is filled with secret cults, communities and circles. People do not understand what they believe in and whom they obey. Station Zero, Manning analysis. From this point it is worth starting a report of a systematic study of quasimorphosis. The important part: “No pathogens were isolated from the group. No bacteria, viruses, fungi, or higher parasites. I know for sure that hormonal imbalances are a consequence of their madness and not the cause. None of those interrogated could describe the reasons why they decided to join the cult. Even the organizers say that this idea just came to them. Some patients report whispers from another world. The phenomenon has no physical cause. But there is a physical effect. I propose to call this phenomenon quasimorphosis.” Learn by heart.

Dr. Eipschwitz.

Why don't we find alive beings in phased buildings? Expedition Sector Louhi-XV: Dr. Peabody has confirmed that Object 0-177C is a sarcophagus. Very similar to a Nahua sarcophagus. Moreover, Peabody insisted that it was sealed as if the funeral rites had already been completed. But the sarcophagus is empty. Where should we look for quasimorphs?

Dr. Eipschwitz.

Eccollapse. It is the answer to my question. Hypothesis: phasing - transition of inanimate objects from pleroma to kenoma; eccollapse - the transition of living objects from pleroma to kenoma. Does this mean that quasimorphs are in some sense "living objects"?

Dr. Eipschwitz.

Project Dislocator Note: If my theory of movement into the pleroma is correct, can I return Tifton combatants back without eccolapse? It will be funny to watch how the mercenaries get back into the kenoma through the bodies of people.

Additional: talk to the authorities about buying prisoners in L-BSA.

Does the existence of phased sarcophagi means that quasimorphs "die" in their bramfaturas? Maybe my hypothesis was wrong from the very beginning. It is necessary to immediately request from Peabody an array of hypotheses about the possible purpose of objects of type 0-177C other than funeral ones.

Dr. Eipschwitz.

The deciphering of stone R-98-21 is progressing. The Knorozov tables still fit after transposition. An analytical analysis of the result is next. From what catches the eye, the Silver Orb is mentioned there. Сosmography of its location relative to Venus shows that it may be Earth.

Dr. Eipschwitz.

The report was sent to Fresco's board of directors. Now they will definitely finance my project on Mercury. However, I can't wait to see what the corporate intelligence officers bring back from Earth. I hope Interdict will not interfere, and the cargo will arrive on time.

Dr. Eipschwitz.

I hope the archive ends up in good hands. I am removing the security levels available to me from Dr. Eipschwitz's personal journal. These... Beings... They are already appearing on the streets of Oddibjord-3. Better death than going through what happened to the guys... The last thing I can do is make the texts of this monster public. The communication channel with SBN is not working. The texts will be in the terminals, I hope sooner or later the one who will save humanity will get to them.

Archivist, Randall Baranov, Star-4 access.

Quasimorphs are not even energy, they are a completely new type of existence. I believe that by moving to Earth they must have either acquired a body without eccolapse or somehow become attached to a material object. My research on the Dislocator will already allow me to create a prototype of a quasimorphic detector. I think I won’t be mistaken if I propose to the management to send a reconnaissance group to Mexico City or another altepetl.

Secret laboratory of the Fresco corporation, where research on quasimorphosis was conducted. Enormous solar panels and a system of mirrors give the factory the appearance of a surrealistic tree. Whoever controls this factory holds a significant share of production in the inner System.

Of course, it is very convenient for extraction stations. Although there are often residential zones here, in case personnel are needed for repairs or direct actions to protect private property.

Here, you can purchase training courses in tactics, strategy, and field support of combat operations. The personnel take pride in the fact that many corporate security service leaders have undergone training here.

The streams of information circulating in the Solar System are exabytes of storms passing by the planets. Network centers are located everywhere to process and route data. Boethius is one such center. The station facilitates data exchange in the central part of the inner System.

Mammoth Terminal is a spaceport for cargo shuttles and interplanetary spacecrafts. Mammoth is a typical spaceport for the inner System. It provides charging, refueling, and regular maintenance services. Due to Mercury's mass, even heavy interplanetary spacecrafts can land here.

Prisons are a delicate service. Penitentiary decisions are provided in various places in the Solar System. l-BSA is one of the most well-known prisons due to its size and quality of service. Recently, information has leaked to the SBN about special containment conditions related to quasimorphosis.

Orbital factories are the main source of goods in the Solar System. Jinxing-Gongchang II is an old but reliable factory. In addition to standard sources of energy, it uses heat from the dense upper layers of Venus' atmosphere.

AnCom is a Hexarch corporation. Once it specialized solely in media products, but recently, there has been information about its increased research focus. After receiving a transmission to the SBN made on behalf of Tetzclan, the HIS Unveild of AnCom was sent to Venus and took a high orbit around the planet.
Platforms camouflaged as extraction stations. Underneath them lies the Fresco research laboratory. It is there that we found information about Dr. Eipshwitz's head being held in the l-BSA prison.
A city located under a geodesic dome, consisting of only five-star hotels. That's how Louhi-City used to look. Now the colony resembles more of a zone of continuous combat actions.

Fortuna University is an engineering and physics university. Cutting-edge research is conducted here, but the main source of income is the sale of training courses. Graduates of Fortuna are almost guaranteed to secure employment and can choose the corporation they prefer.

Most colonies on Venus are located under geodesic domes. This is partly necessary to cool and discharge the atmosphere, and partly to contain highly invasive GMO flora and fauna. Oddibord-3 is a Fresco geodesic heavily affected by unknown events. There is information in the SBN that something terrible is happening on the underground levels of the colony.
Clotho-Node is a transit base under a geodesic dome that former owner Fresco used to access hard-to-reach places in the jungles. For unknown reasons, it is now in complete ruins.

The Feathered Temple is a cluster of phased structures amidst the jungles. It seems that a significant portion of Venus's bramfatura has shifted here. The place received its name due to the prevailing bird theme in the design of quasimorphic structures.

Market agents encrypt everything they send to the common network. However, everyone knows that one of the advantages of owning routing stations is intercepting data for subsequent decryption and resale attempts. Heritage Station is the largest routing node in the inner System. Almost the entire colossal volume of information passing through space from Mercury to the Asteroid Belt is filtered and redirected through Heritage.
Arcadis Transit Terminal is an orbital port for refueling, charging, and servicing interplanetary spacecrafts. It is a highly profitable enterprise known as the "Earth's main port" in the System.

Pine Gap Training Center is the oldest sociological laboratory in the Solar System. It also houses a large educational center where you can purchase educational services for manager and psychologist training.

Skylab is a costly system of engineering test site. Almost a quarter of patents in the inner System are associated with inventions made here. Owning Skylab promises enormous daily profits to its owners.

Due to the interdiction regime, visiting Earth is not accessible to everyone in the Solar System. To avoid causing difficulties for its numerous clients, the SBN corporation established its headquarters in orbit. It is said that the ISS Station AES is based on an ancient orbital station dating back to the state period. Besides serving as SBN's headquarters, the station is an information routing node, ensuring a monopoly on information passage in the inner System.

On Earth, there is almost no production. At least that's what is reported in materials distributed through the SBN. Factories have been moved into orbit to preserve the fragile ecology of humanity's cradle. Akatsuki Kojo is a very old-fashioned orbital factory that operates on atomic energy.
Paragon FC is an ancient factory that still runs on atomic energy. Such factories are now scarce in the System. Nevertheless, this industrial workhorse provides its owner with sufficient profits.

Residential and working areas are a highly profitable business in the Solar System. Once you build, buy, or otherwise acquire such a location, you start receiving an inexhaustible stream of rental dividends. The orbital city Phenomenon fully lives up to its name. Berths of docking docks protruding in all directions from bulky modules make it resemble a ball of spaghetti hanging in space.
MTZ is a real city in a stationary lunar orbit. The convenience and comfort of the modules make their rental highly attractive, resulting in extremely high income for their owner.

The main fuel in the Solar System is quantum liquid H-3. Qi Helium-3 is the largest station for processing Helium-3 into quantum liquid. Within the inner System, this plant is the only stable source of this fuel.

The Moon is a convenient launching pad for flights into the outer System. The AnCap Dogma Harbor is a large refueling and repair orbital port. Stopping here can help avoid the need to linger in orbit around Mars on the way to the Asteroid Belt and beyond.

Moon TC is the tallest skyscraper in New Seattle. It is a residential and working complex. Renting here can bring incredible profits to the owner. This is why owning MTC is the subject of a real trade war. And often not just a trade war.

The second-largest building on the Moon. Candle Arcology is a glossy black building resembling a candle. When the Sun rises above New Seattle, bright sparks of gleams play on its surface. The building is intended to symbolize the wealth and professionalism of the RealWare corporation.

The third-largest building on the Moon. Alliance Arcology is a city within a city. It has business levels, residential levels, and even production levels. The daily income from owning the arcology is difficult to estimate.

Tycho Terminal is the main spaceport on the surface of the Moon. Interplanetary spacecrafts rarely land here since AnCap Dogma Harbor is quite nearby. However, it serves as a constant landing and takeoff point for transport shuttles.

Shu Center is an information routing node. Thousands of petabytes of information pass through this information complex every hour. Almost everything coming from the outer System to the inner one goes through Shu Center.

There are not many orbital factories operating on atomic energy beyond Earth's orbit. Red Tiangong is one of them. Due to its proximity to the outer System, owning this property comes with risks. It's unknown which workers sympathize with Civil Resistance and are capable of sabotage. However, the property owner has the right to protect it by any means.

Rebus Sky City consists of several modules - residential, educational, and business sections. Due to its location on the border of the inner System, many tenants are tied to this orbital station. This means that the source of rental income will be almost guaranteed for the owner.

RealWare is a Hexarchy corporation. The Hexarchy is an informal alliance of six major corporations that contributed to the Great Anarchic Revolution. RealWare is one of the wealthiest Hexarchs. This conglomerate deals with virtually everything, but its main source of income is weapons and industrial systems. HIS Ares is stationed near Mars, ready to deploy anywhere in the Solar System to protect the corporation's interests.

Argyre-14 Mining Station is a colony with extremely challenging working conditions. That's how honest competitive struggle goes. If you're not ready to invent or organize, if you lack the sacred flame of Atlantis - you will sell your labor. And that's okay. Become a worker and take a worthy place in a free anarchic society. The station is located right in the middle of the desert. Life here resembles life in boomtowns during the colonization of North America's Wild West.

Karst Oasis is a geological research station on the edge of a Karst crater. Mars's geology research has long disappointed many. The laboratory continues its work "out of habit." However, corporations usually don't tolerate idle expenses. And perhaps there is still something to study here.

Gloria Terminal is a spaceport that provides launch, landing, refueling, charging, and current maintenance of shuttles and interplanetary spacecrafts. The terminal is located on the outskirts of Intercity, the only city on Mars that was conceived as a symbol of humanity's prosperity but ended up half-abandoned, swept by dusty winds, and the graveyard of many hopes.

Amidst the desert streets of Intercity, covered in a thick layer of reddish dust, stands one truly vibrant building - Intercity Trade Center Arcology. Despite the skepticism towards Mars, one can make substantial profits here from those seeking fortune on the red planet.

Charon DocBay is a refueling and repair spaceport on the orbit of Phobos. A place where a pub occupies about half of the useful area of a residential module. Tired and experienced workers from the outer System spend their time here.

Canaan Terminal is a station for servicing, charging and repairing ground equipment. From here it is extremely convenient to get to remote inaccessible places of Phobos. Apart from these obvious features, the base is extremely convenient if you need a secluded place away from the main routes but still functional and with trained staff.

At the very beginning of the space age, people had high hopes for the colonization of Mars. The possibilities of the red planet seemed limitless. All these dreams were destined to be dispelled by dusty winds. Since that time, many small colonies remained, which were to become new business and intellectual centers. This also applies to the moons of Mars. The Hypnos-2 colony is a profitable but still extremely provincial asset.

Orphan Mining Base is a mining facility on Phobos. Eternal twilight, a suspension of dust, hard work in spacesuits - all that awaits workers here. For some, this is a way to start a working career if they fail to pay for education, and for some, it is a platform for campaigning against the New Corporate Ethic.

On Mars, Phobos and Deimos, colonies often combine opposite functions. Rogue City is both a charging and repair terminal for ground vehicles and at the same time serves as a corporate colony that brings constant dividends for rent to its owner.

Swift and Voltaire is an unexpectedly large, by Martian standards, engineering and sociological laboratory, as well as an educational center. It is located neatly between the Swift and Voltaire craters.

The High Ares Post was founded by the military of one of the old states as a radar station. After the Great Anarchist Revolution, it was taken over by a corporation. The post, which has grown noticeably since then, has been constantly changing hands.

Warden-D is more of a warehouse system and staging post than a full-fledged colony. Life on Deimos is simple, even ascetic. Most often, the staff of such places consists of some hermits and religious fanatics.

Hidden away from prying eyes are the sociological laboratory and a small educational center. Dark Flora trains spies and corporate agents who need special moral lability. It is said that negotiators coming out of here have two minds, one of which has suppressed sincerity. It is this consciousness that seizes control at the critical moment.
Maybe someday the Sundog Zone will become a full-fledged colony on Deimos. So far, this asset can only be useful as a semi-secret transshipment base.
A multi-level hydroponic factory for producing natural food. An important source of calories for the Internal System and a valuable asset.

A space where you can rent a warehouse for storing anything. There are warehouses shielded from radiation or any type of waves. The asset owner receives not only a good fee for renting warehouses but also everything stored in case of overdue rent.
A small business center and control center for Fuller's position in orbit and the satellite's main systems. Owners of all other stations on Fuller are required to pay contributions to the Core owner.

An educational institution for wealthy families. Here you cannot get engineering or working education; they will not teach management theory here. All the Academy can provide is a classical education for the class of ancap-aristocrats.
A multidisciplinary medical center. In addition, there is a research unit here.
A refueling station for cubecentric engine spacecrafts that have business near the Sun.

A colony located in one of the spacecrafts that form Volcano. A pile of dark slums in the womb of a partially-disassembled HIS. People from here will take any job, so corporations on Mercury have no shortage of cheap labor resources.

A research laboratory that carefully isolated from Kizzuwatna. Here, the photosphere of the Sun, the phenomenon of magnetism and other fundamental physical phenomena are studied at the forefront of science.

A physical research center for studying different types of radiation. It is also home to a small engineering division that develops personal weapons based on radiation and atomic energy. The corporations that own the center are not trying to make a direct profit from it, but as much as possible for the production of such rare weapons.

An advanced power plant that extracts energy directly from photons. The Tesla-Musk System installed on it is the intellectual property of the Dilthey Corporation, whose secret is carefully preserved. No one has yet been able to open the system for study. Dilthey installed a multi-factor defense system with explosives there.
A hydroponic farm that uses solar energy and radiation to produce advanced GMO plants. If you eat something vegan anywhere in the System, then the raw materials most likely came from Photosphere-17.

An entertainment center providing a unique service. In a radiation-shielded shuttle, you will fly so close to the Sun that its magnetic fields would directly affect your brain. The result is strictly individual. Some people experience an encounter with God, some experience their own birth, some get rid of childhood traumas. Literally anything can happen with your consciousness. The center does not provide security guarantees. For treatment of microtumors, it is recommended to contact a medical facility within a month after the travel.
This is the laboratory for the research of ultrahigh temperatures. An extremely profitable asset and one of the richest sources of industrial innovation in the System.

This is school of intelligence field mastery. Tutors don’t care who owns the asset, as long as they provide them a good life rate. Here, enormous resources are used to teach espionage, information extraction, and interrogation.

This is the prison that built in the depths of the Mechta. Do you know that Mechta is word for Dream in Russian? This is literally prison that built-in inside the dream. Anyway, the prison is very conservative, without any frills. There are cages, long corridors, tired and angry guards.
This is the large brothel that can satisfy the most demanding tastes.
This is the training ground inside the Mechta, which you can rent and fulfill there any fantasies associated with the use of almost any type of weapon.

This is a business center where branches of many corporations operate. True, managers are sent here as if into exile. And although many eventually find ways to have fun on the Mechta, such a business trip does not bode well for their career.
E is a laboratory for the production of recreational and relaxation drugs. Here you will find a tablet or injection for every taste and color.

This is a space port on the surface of the Mechta. Since the Mechta is located in a very high Venusian orbit, this terminal is a convenient stopover point for those moving towards or away from the Sun without stopping on Venus.
"Business center above Venus" as told commercial. There are greenhouses, rich restaurants, observation decks. The life of the upper class was in full swing here until the Tezctlan invasion began.

This is a flexible space organized to accommodate security personnel. There are gyms, lecture rooms, and a living area. Corporation that owns the Blade always has at his disposal a reserve of fresh and motivated security specialists. Training ground got its name in honor of the Eclipse Blades PMC. They defended asteroid from contractors of an unknown corporation that wanted to stop the HAVOC project.
This is the specialized plant for the production of robots and equipment for them.
This is a residential colony on HAVOC. It is the main source of labor in the Venusian habitable cluster.
This is hydroponic farm for growing natural food crops. There are hectares of earth-type arable land covered by a geodesic dome.

This is the astronomical research center on the external side of Tsiolkovsky. Powerful telescopes and radar dishes are aimed at deep space here. There are rumors that, under the guise of a research center, the owners of the asset always organize an intelligence base here.

A colossal automatic factory for the production of synthetic food proteins and the cultivation of plant food. Everything that grows here, from cockroaches to artificial cow livers, is used as food for the inhabitants of the System. Without Chick-Chick/Moo-Moo, extraterrestrial colonies would starve to death.

This is the business center housing, corporate offices that provide communication with the Earth. One might say that these are corporate embassies, but the Hexarchy has declared such language offensive due to the comparison of corporations with the old-fashioned states.

CoDT or Center of Defense Technologies is a large specialized factory, a rarity in the System. Typically, factories can be easily reconfigured to produce any product. However, the CoDT works with one goal. This goal is to produce as many weapons as possible. For defensive purposes, of course.
This is the Zero Gravity Training Center. Experienced teaching staff will train your personnel for extravehicular work for a reasonable fee.
